original: Lindwall, Bengt Anders Gabriel, lektor, Norrköping, f. 14/11/88 i Oskarshamn av bankkass. Adolf L. o. Märta Wickbom. G. 1. 16 m. Maria Damberg-Ekgren; 2. 31 m. Clara Westbeck. Barn: Britt f. 17, Barbro 19, d. 27, Ulla 21, Björn 23, Karin 29, Ulf 32. — Mog:ex. i Kalmar 07, fil. kand. i Upps. 09, fil. lic. 13, fil. dr 19, provår i Sthlm 17. E. o. lektor i Söderhamn 13-14, Södertälje 14-15, lär. v. Sthlms ’Samgymn. 16, e. ö. lektor i Eskilstuna 17-18, Eksjö 18-20, lektor v. Landskrona folksk :sem. 19, v. Strängnäs s, å., i Eskilstuna 30, lektor i matem. v. Norrköp. h. a. 1. sed. 40. Skr.: Jordans teori f. prim. metacykl. ekv. av gradtalet pn (grad:avh. 18), Himlarymdens gåtor (hylln :’skr. t. H. Dahlgren 22), Vegetarismen ur estetisk synp., Övnibok i fysik (43), Övn:-bok i matem. I-III (43-44), övers. o. bear’b. ett stort antal populärfram-stäMn. i matem., fysik, atomteori m. m.
translated:
Lindwall, Bengt Anders Gabriel, lecturer, Norrköping, b. 14/11/88 in Oskarshamn to bank cashier Adolf L. and Märta Wickbom. Married 1st wife Maria Damberg-Ekgren for 16 years, and 2nd wife Clara Westbeck for 31 years. Children: Britt b. 17, Barbro b. 19, deceased 27, Ulla b. 21, Björn b. 23, Karin b. 29, Ulf b. 32. 

Graduated with a master's degree in law from Kalmar in 1907, Bachelor of Arts in Uppsala in 1909, licentiate of philosophy in 1913, doctor of philosophy in 1919, internship in Stockholm in 1917. Deputy lecturer in Söderhamn from 1913-1914, Södertälje from 1914-1915, teacher at Stockholm's Samgymnasium in 1916, permanent lecturer in Eskilstuna from 1917-1918, Eksjö from 1918-1920, lecturer at the Landskrona public school seminar in 1919, at the Strängnäs seminary in the same year, in Eskilstuna in 1930, lecturer in mathematics at Norrköping high school from 1940. 

Publications: Theory of Jordan for primary metacyclic equations of the degree pn (degree: dependent on 18), Mysteries of the Universe (dedicated to H. Dahlgren in 1922), Vegetarianism from an aesthetic perspective, Exercise book in physics (1943), Exercise book in mathematics I-III (1943-1944), translation and adaptation of a large number of popular presentations in mathematics, physics, atomic theory, etc.

publication.name: Theory of Jordan for Primary Metacyclic Equations of the Degree pn
Translation and Adaptation of a Large Number of Popular Presentations
publication.description: in mathematics, physics, atomic theory, etc.
